update.description:
A big chunk of gzclient's loading time is spent generating visualizations. With this pull request, visualizations are generated on demand instead, so the generation burden is not concentrated on startup. This is especially important when loading big worlds with thousands of links.

This also addressed a TODO for moving the collision visual generation to the client.

And it also fixed this problem:

1. On the top menu, choose "View" something

1. Visualization is turned on for all existing models

1. Insert a new model and the visualization is not there.
update.title: Generate visualizations on demand

content.raw: It looks like all comments have been addressed. Will merge soon
content.html: It looks like all comments have been addressed. Will merge soon

content.html: ah yes I just did a clean build and confirmed that there're no more error messages. Sorry for the noise

content.html: I cleaned my environment and I'm not get any errors anymore. Are you still getting any?

content.raw: I just removed those error messages: 754644e. I don't think they're necessary, because in case we try to load the child before the parent, we just skip loading the child and go back to it later.
content.html: I just removed those error messages: 754644e. I don't think they're necessary, because in case we try to load the child before the parent, we just skip loading the child and go back to it later.

content.raw: Did a fix here: 51ded8c, which relies on `ShowJoints` being called later. Seems not to break anything. Maybe it will be a problem once we support displaying dynamically created joints?
content.html: Did a fix here: 51ded8c, which relies on ShowJoints being called later. Seems not to break anything. Maybe it will be a problem once we support displaying dynamically created joints?

content.raw:
@scpeters showed me a problem:

1. Open Gazebo and View -> Joints

1. Insert several double pendulums

Some of the joint visuals for the pendulums will show up tiny. After some digging I found out that this is happening because the joint msg may be processed before the visual msgs. So when we get the link's bounding box to check its size and scale the joint visual, the box has size zero due to the lack of visuals. I'm trying to fix this.
content.html:
@scpeters showed me a problem:

  1. Open Gazebo and View -> Joints

  2. Insert several double pendulums

Some of the joint visuals for the pendulums will show up tiny. After some digging I found out that this is happening because the joint msg may be processed before the visual msgs. So when we get the link's bounding box to check its size and scale the joint visual, the box has size zero due to the lack of visuals. I'm trying to fix this.

content.raw: I wonder how this works with nested models, because then the root visual is different from the parent visual. I suspect that parent, as done here, is what we want.
content.html: I wonder how this works with nested models, because then the root visual is different from the parent visual. I suspect that parent, as done here, is what we want.

content.raw:
I'm seeing some error messages which I think shouldn't be there:

1. Open Gazebo

1. View -> Center of Mass

1. Insert a box. Its CoM shows, but we also get this error:

    `[Err] [Visual.cc:3101] Couldn't get link message for visual [unit_box::link]`
content.html:
I'm seeing some error messages which I think shouldn't be there:

content.raw:
found a problem with missing collision visuals when loading a non-empty world with models. Fixed in 3b440e1. @chapulina I had to revert the changes in `Collision::FillMsg` otherwise gzclient doesn't get the collision visual msgs. We can figure out a way to move that logic to the client in a later pull request.

[homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/701/) - ok
content.html:
found a problem with missing collision visuals when loading a non-empty world with models. Fixed in 3b440e1. @chapulina I had to revert the changes in Collision::FillMsg otherwise gzclient doesn't get the collision visual msgs. We can figure out a way to move that logic to the client in a later pull request.

homebrew - ok
